data.title: Americans can’t afford their pets. It’s pushing animal shelters to the brink.
data.description: Americans adopted animals at record rates in 2020. Now many are headed back to the shelter amid high inflation and a housing crisis.
data.snippet: Lonely and stuck at home, millions of Americans turned to animals for comfort in the early days of the Covid-19 pandemic, adopting and fostering cats and dogs f...

data.title: Tofu is still a popular alternative to meat, but is it actually good for you? Here's what the science says
data.description: Tofu is often used as a substitute for animal-based foods, but with such high levels of soy, is tofu actually healthy? Here's what research shows.
data.snippet: Tofu was created centuries ago in Asia from mainly soybeans and water. Today, it is one of the most popular plant-based foods and an easy substitute for animal ...

data.title: Traveler stopped at Dulles airport with 77 dry seahorses, 5 dead snakes
data.description: Two travelers were stopped recently with prohibited products, including on person who had dead snakes and dried seahorses.
data.keywords: snake, U.S. Customs and Border Protection
data.snippet: Two travelers at Dulles airport this month were stopped with an array of unusual items — including dried seahorses, dead snakes, an ointment made with snails ...
